summary: The text discusses the reigns of various emperors leading up to the defeat of the Jews by Vespasian in the first year of his rule, which marks the fulfillment of a prophecy by Daniel. It argues that by the time of the Jewish defeat, all conditions set by Daniel's prophecy were met, totaling 490 years, including the complete transgression, the end of sin, the removal of iniquity, the establishment of everlasting justice, and the fulfillment of the vision, including the anointing of the Holy of Holies.
